website_summaries.verdict: For novice body builders learning why muscles are trained in a specific way, this weightlifting book provides many of the answers.
pros: Supplements the author’s volume on anatomy with a guide to workouts with strength and body building in mind
Excellent breakdown of muscle-specific exercises, along with do’s and don’ts
cons: Lacking in some strength training points that advanced body builders or physical therapists might notice
Dumbbell and bodyweight specific exercises only

customer_reviews.title: comprehensive exercise guide
customer_reviews.text: I like this as a general resource, in that it covers multiple approaches and tactics in the weight room. The illustrations are generally excellent, but in a few places, reusing previously published material was weak, in that some improvements could have been made. Lazy! Also, the emphasis is on adding bulk and looking good. Some focus on stabilizing ones core, on other means of injury protection would have been appreciated. And, like most such books, the assumption is that the reader is young. Some suggestions for older lifters would have been beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: Gary  Kurzban

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have Resource for anyone wanting to build the body of their dreams!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent resource! Images are well-detailed and accurate. VERY pleased with this purchase. It is also very informative when it comes to recognizing what is hurting when we push ourselves too far or injure ourselves doing some other activity...great knowledge reference!
customer_reviews.author: PSP

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, the best book for training with dumbells.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite strength training book. The emphasis is dumbbells which is what I wanted. Each exercise has a detailed description of what muscles are involved and the same for each variation of a particular exercise. All the muscle groups are covered. Well explained and illustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia L. Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Love this book!!
customer_reviews.text: Very informative and to the point. I love that it has the pictures of the muscles that are being targeted by each exercise and it explains the importance of the different types of approaches to developing muscles and strength training.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hiarmes

customer_reviews.title: Essential Book for Form and Routines
customer_reviews.text: This book is excellent. I first got it from the library, along with the first anatomy book and the women’s workout book. I bought the workout book because it is filled with excellent tips on form and everything else related to lifting weights and getting strong. Delavier is a genius.
customer_reviews.author: ChloeDiego

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for me as a beginner working out at home
customer_reviews.text: This book has some neat ideas I never would've thought of myself (ex: how to get around not having a bench, antagonistic supersets). It also has a lot of information about how NOT to hurt yourself. I like that they clearly show which muscles are worked and describe variations to the main exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Greenbaum

customer_reviews.title: women's training vs mens training
customer_reviews.text: seriously only have 2 pages devoted to women's training? and 10 for men... like yes I can still use the book but this really annoys me. Women can lift and do all these things so why even bother putting in gender sections if you are going to such a poor job of it
customer_reviews.author: Danielle hammond

customer_reviews.title: Must Read For Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Started weight lifting at home a year and a half ago, got this recently and has been a complete game changer for me. Descriptive exercises and structured workout routines, extremely helpful tool for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good visualizations; lots of variations for the exercise moves.
customer_reviews.text: The illustrations and photos in the book meet my needs for visualizing the muscles being worked during various strength training exercises. I especially like the variations of the moves/exercises. The variations on the moves enables an older person like myself to make adjustments that I would not have needed when I was younger.
customer_reviews.author: D. MILLS

customer_reviews.title: Training book
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great price and will use this vendor again when needed. Step son uses, says it helps him target his exercises.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cundiff

customer_reviews.title: Very interesting guide
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the 3 volumes: Strength Training Anatomy-3rd Edition The Strength Training Anatomy Workout The Strength Training Anatomy Workout II,The Strength Training Anatomy Workout) I just started going to the gym and exercise at home. I use these books and my training has improved a lot and become more effective. In a short time itself the results have started showing themselves.The guides also show how we should NOT do exercises that can potentially harm us in the short or long term. Its a must have collection for sport people who want to improve their body strength and looks.
customer_reviews.author: Skyguardian

customer_reviews.title: Great info, bad female depiction
customer_reviews.text: I give it four stars due to the pornographic drawings that are extremely unnecessary. My children could reference this book if not for the blatant use of women's sexual prowess and drawings of their genitelia (which they do not show on the men oddly enough). I have pencil drawn underwear and covered the nipples on the women so my young daughter may read the book for her questions on working out. I am a weight lifter and enjoy the inner workings of this, this is a great book to answer questions, see the areas worked and formulate a workout plan to target areas for beginners. Highly recommend this informative book.
customer_reviews.author: KellyJC

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous reference
customer_reviews.text: The beauty, depth, and richness of this book is amazing. It is a work of art on a topic where you would not necessarily expect it.
customer_reviews.author: Bada

customer_reviews.title: Detailed
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed. It will help give me an explanation on questions I have. Has several specific workouts depending on a sport or goal that you are trying to meet.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great read
customer_reviews.text: Bought this book for my brother and he loved it. Explains the workouts and muscles that an average person would understand.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Diel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Gives good examples of muscle groups your working or that you want to work on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Anatomy Strength Training Workout
customer_reviews.text: The body renderings of the muscles are absolutely incredible. It's one thing to have knowledge about weight training, but this book takes it to a new level. It will show you exactly what you want to do, and--equally important--will show you how to avoid injuries during your workout. There is a whole series of books (Stretching, Core, etc.) and they are all fabulous. Frankly, I don't know how they can sell these beautifully illustrated books at such a reasonable price (about $14 per book), but I recommend that you get one (or more) and see for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: airbusart

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a must have for anyone into lifting and working out excellent
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have Workout Guide
customer_reviews.text: The Delavier series of Anatomy/Strength Training Guides should be in everyone's fitness library. Easy to understand, great artwork, just enough information while avoiding overload. It is great to know what you are doing to yourself and your muscle groups. So many people workout with a complete misunderstanding of what their muscles want and how they react to various exercises.Devalier fills in the information gaps for all of us when it comes to the proper exercises for the results we wish to achieve.
customer_reviews.author: TYSEXP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all
customer_reviews.text: Quality in a paperback Easy to set your works out up Easy in showing you an informing you of what you are trying to do for self fitness
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Great reading for knowledge of exercising
customer_reviews.text: It is a great for the knowledge of exercising the the whole body.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Brown

customer_reviews.title: Delavier Rules
customer_reviews.text: Delavier's books are the best I have ever purchased, and I'm 54 years old. I have spent literally hundreds of dollars on personal trainers and I am more impressed with Delavier's books than any PT I have ever had. I bought five of his books including this one, which cost less than one session with a PT. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MasterMarquette

customer_reviews.title: Great weight lifting book
customer_reviews.text: This author has a great ability to convey information about weight training. He describes many lifts with illustrated pictures and explanations that really put the reader in the mindset of recognizing which muscles are engaged. If you are new to weight training and intermediate, this book will give you solid information about lifts and teach you new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Keeken

customer_reviews.title: Very Detailed! I learned a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: While this book works on the assumption that you are working out at home with limited equipment it goes into great detail how to exercies different muscles/muscle groups. While I don't agree with some of the assumptions it contains many insights which I found very useful and have not heard from other sources. Also a good reference because of the excellent drawings.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G. Vajda

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE best book to get your strength training program together. It has a great breakdown of different workouts and variations to use with detailed images. Great for newbies and the experienced to learn some new tricks.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: While the book had interesting pictures and clearly explained the anatomy of which muscle groups were being worked with which exercises, I was looking more for a guideline of targeted exercises to break up the monotony of my routine. The book was insightful and interesting and would allow beginner to expert gym buff the opportunity to really target a particular group or groups of muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Zamer

customer_reviews.title: i would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: the exercises included in this book are standard faire and the explanations basic, but the illustrations and method of showing active and passive muscles engaged in anexercise is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: mjrdomo

customer_reviews.title: Great book if you want to work out at home
customer_reviews.text: Delavier is one of the great trainers/educators in the world of fitness. This book is aimed at beginners and all of the exercises can be done at home with dumbbells, resistance bands, a pull-up bar, chair, and bed. The follow-up book, The Strength Training Anatomy Workout II is a bigger book that shows a greater range of exercises done primarily with barbells, dumbbells, and machines. Unless you are specifically looking for exercises done primarily with dumbbells, you will find everything and more in the second book, so it's not necessary to have this one as well. Ditto for the original Strenth-Training Anatomy. The Strength Training Anatomy Workout II combines all of Delavier's wisdom in a single volume.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my bf in prison and he loves it, describes detail about every muscle you use when you do workouts
customer_reviews.author: georgia g

customer_reviews.title: Received quickly
customer_reviews.text: Book received quickly and was much better condition then I expected.
customer_reviews.author: D. Etim

customer_reviews.title: An great addition to our Workout Library
customer_reviews.text: My son has gotten into weight lifting and our "workout" library needed a bit of expansion. This book shows him all the muscles and how they respond to each exercise. It also helps him to plan workouts by showing him single muscles or compound. It's great for beginners or those who haven't been working out very long, like my son, who just started this past year.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Zydel

customer_reviews.title: No one illustrates that better than Frederic Delavier
customer_reviews.text: If you lift, you need to know your own muscle anatomy. No one illustrates that better than Frederic Delavier. This may be the best sports anatomy lesson that a layperson can get.
customer_reviews.author: 540 Buyer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for those serious about working out
customer_reviews.text: Great illustrations, detailed workouts and explanations as to which workouts work which muscles. This book will definitely broaden your level of knowledge, trust me you will NOT be disappointed by buying it. It will teach you plenty of things that you wish you woud've known years ago.
customer_reviews.author: QMGONZO

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this book, it’s so informative and I really learned a lot from it. I highly recommend this volume and the other volumes too.
customer_reviews.author: Akiva Rubin

customer_reviews.title: It is all am looking for and more
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to work out video's are OK but this helps me do it right it's working for me
customer_reviews.author: Ladypea

customer_reviews.title: This book gives is great for someone starting to strength train
customer_reviews.text: This book gives is great for someone starting to strength train. I had not trained before reading this book. After reading Strength Training Anatomy Workout I felt like I was very prepare. The pictures, I thought, were extremely helpful in picking what areas you want to improve and to make sure that you are feeling the stretch where you are supposed to. Great book for all levels.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great Books
customer_reviews.text: I'm no workout fanatic, but I truly enjoyed reading the workout book. Lots of pictures and pointers, as well as pinpointing exactly which muscle would be targeted, which was a major goal of my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kbfambuyer

customer_reviews.title: contains great tips to get the most out of your program
customer_reviews.text: use it as main reference for setting up exercise programs and to check exercises while working out. contains great tips to get the most out of your program.
customer_reviews.author: girdpt

customer_reviews.title: A must for those serious about their weight and strength training
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous books with clear succinct explanatiions, fabulous anatomical renderings, and great tips. I feel like this along with the Strength Training Book should be mandatory reading for the person embarking on a training program and for those enthusiasts who want to know more about weight training for strength and better health. Should be spiral bound so you can use it easier at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: PHILIP J. ALIOTTA,

customer_reviews.title: Great illustrations
customer_reviews.text: Very thorough and explains how each movement affects the muscle. I like that there's a variety of exercises for one muscle to combat getting bored with one routine. The sample workouts in the back were helpful. Excellent book overall!
customer_reviews.author: a hakim

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: The book has excellent illustrations of the muscles in the body and exercises which work the muscles. Very well written and very useful. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John Kern

customer_reviews.title: Good Communications, I would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Fast Shipper, Item as stated, Good Communications, I would purchase again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Silva

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Everything that was advertised and more. Helped me understand in great detail how my muscles work and the best way to train them. A must have.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Janes

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent book for novice and expert. Great detail and nice illustrations. Very insightful book to add to any library.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Howell

customer_reviews.title: GREAT book
customer_reviews.text: VERY informative and well written book. It's worth the money
customer_reviews.author: LanaB

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful anatomy lesson
customer_reviews.text: A terrific lesson in anatomy. Great to see what muscles you're using when you're working out. Plus great workout tips.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Alot to take in, Processing slowly, which is what the author says to do.

customer_reviews.title: Great explanation from a scientific point of view in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great explanation from a scientific point of view in a clear way. Excellent for me since it is helping to change to my body!

customer_reviews.title: Strength Training Anatomy Workout
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book with lots of good information! I recommend the book to anyone who would like to start a healtier life style but is not sure how to start.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: I am using this book for a Master's class and the information is really great and organized. I have pretty much read the entire book and my class is only halfway completed. Really like the book.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for anyone wanting to get into weight training
customer_reviews.text: Very informative book. Would recommend for anyone wanting to get into weight training.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive book. Lots of exercises with detailed drawings showing which muscles are activated. As a certified personal trainer I found this book more informative than much of the CPT training books.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ratner

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to start a workout program, reguardless of level
customer_reviews.text: I needed a guideline to start working out again. Big help in making sure I didn't over do-it to start off with.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really good book has helped me on my workouts I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro N.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: As a personal trainer, I found more information in this book than in my text. A must have book for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Reed Hill

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: very informative nice clean and the pictures are very helpful get it if youre in the gym very useful; like it thank you..
customer_reviews.author: magic

customer_reviews.title: Strength Training
customer_reviews.text: A great resource to achieve my fitness goals. Well illustrated, detailed, explaining muscle development and functionality. Describes techniques, equipment, correct posture and workout programs. This book is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Novak

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well thought out and helpful when determining strengthening programs for athletes of varying levels of fitness,
customer_reviews.author: Biker Bob R-D

customer_reviews.title: Strength Training Anatomy Workout
customer_reviews.text: This book is fabulous? Very graphic as to what muscle group(s) are being worked. Great book for Personal Trainers as well as nursing students! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book, and the language was easy to follow. I bought this book for a class and was worried that I would be lost in tech/trainer jargon. It was really easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne A. Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Exercise Techniques
customer_reviews.text: It's required for a class I'm taking and it's helping a lot as we have to plan out entire exercise routines for clients so it's a good book
customer_reviews.author: Colin Covitz

customer_reviews.title: great study tool
customer_reviews.text: i need this book to study for an upcoming certification exam and it has already been so helpful. i can't wait to buy other bookts from this author.
customer_reviews.author: danielle garcia tsolias

customer_reviews.title: Description Should beRevised
customer_reviews.text: Book is for dumbells & body weight exercises only. Description shold have indicated this. Probably alright for a beginner or someone that doesn't have access to barbells or has limited workout space,
customer_reviews.author: vamcman

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Just starting to really get into the book. I like both the content and the quality (pages laid very nicely and eye-friendly). Already highlighting stuff like crazy for future reference. Only reason not 5 stars is that I have not gotten real deep yet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Strength Training Anatomy Workout
customer_reviews.text: This is a awesome and detailed book which i would recommend to anyone looking to put your workouts together and get results
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Husband!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband and he loves it! He uses it everytime he works out. He loves the diagrams to see what he is working with each exercise. I also have used the womens workouts and the book is very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Erin H

customer_reviews.title: A dissapointment after the original masterpiece.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this book. I was expecting another masterpiece like the original 'Strength Training Anatomy'. Instead, this book is disjointed and confusing. A lot of the illustrations were taken from Strength Training Anatomy. There's even one drawing with a description that gives a correction about the form - instead of making a new drawing, the writer just lazily reused a drawing from the previous book. Most of the new illustrations are mediocre photos. Also, this book focuses entirely on dumbbell training, no barbell work is included. I feel like some of the workout routines are interesting and I will be trying them. Still, this book rates only a 'meh' due to the sloppy way it was constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Phil & Liz

customer_reviews.title: it was ok
customer_reviews.text: this is really for people who are looking to make a home gym and not really for people who have been working out for more then 6 months. Spend your money on Arnolds Encyclopedia
customer_reviews.author: vmi332

customer_reviews.text: Thought there would be good content, but it was super basic stuff in this book big disappointment

customer_reviews.title: Okay book
customer_reviews.text: This book isn't very provocative on it's own, yet will push you to think provocatively on your own. You figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: harold

customer_reviews.title: The Cover Title is misleading..
customer_reviews.text: The book sits in my book shelf untouched because I bought the book as I thought it had gym workouts. Unfortunately it has only home workouts..

customer_reviews.title: Strength Training Anatomy Workout
customer_reviews.text: Received the book today. Starts out by telling me "why" I should workout at home.Thanks for letting me know before hand that the book was for home workouts. Weights, elastic bands and bodyweight exercises? Sorry, only saw a guy and girl lifting on cover. Should have waited for more reviews. And on a side note, if anyone went to a gym wearing the shorts the guys wear in the book, I see why they workout at home. I loved the anatomy book, and I really wanted to love this one. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Billyjack

customer_reviews.title: A Huge Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This book is for absolute beginners and teaches the reader how to work out at home. A waste of time for me. A huge mistake for the author, whose Strength Training Anatomy is a must-have for serous weight-trainers. I can't imagine why he took such a detour, writing this book, which is suitable for viewers of Oprah.
customer_reviews.author: Universal City Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my teenage son so he could get a better understanding of how to workout. This book provides a bunch of different exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Van
